com.skysql.java

Class MonData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skysql.java.MonData

  • public class MonData
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface to the monitoring database, this is the database that holds the definition of what to Monitor and into which the monitored values are written.
    Author:
    Mark Riddoch, Massimo Siani

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MonData()
      Constructor used when the system id is not known.
      MonData(int systemID)
      Constructor for the Monitor data class.

    • Method Detail

      • registerAPI

        public void registerAPI(java.lang.String component,
               java.lang.String version,
               java.lang.String release,
               java.lang.String date)
        Registers some information about a component in the API. If a parameter is null, it is not registered nor updated, but it is not deleted if already registered in the API.
        Parameters:
        component - the name of the component to register in the API
        version - the version number. Typical format is Major.minor-build
        release - the release number
        date - the build date of the current version

      • getSystemList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getSystemList()
        Fetch the list of System ID's to Monitor.
        Returns:
        The list of SystemIDs defined in the database

      • getSystemMonitorInterval

        public java.lang.Integer getSystemMonitorInterval()
        Fetch the Monitor probe interval.
        Returns:
        The Monitor interval in seconds

      • IPMonitor

        public boolean IPMonitor()
        IPMonitor Get the system property IPMonitor - this controls the running of the IPMonitor for EC2 Cloud based deployments. The default is true for reasons of backward compatibility.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the IP Monitor should be run

      • getProvisionedNodes

        public boolean getProvisionedNodes()
        Compare the date when the current instance last updated the objects in the current system with the last update date retrieved from the API. If necessary, the updated objects are saved in place of the older ones. If this happens, a return value of true is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the objects have been updated, false otherwise

      • getNodeList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getNodeList()
        Return the list of Node id's to Monitor.
        Returns:
        The list of nodes in the database

      • getNodeListCached

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getNodeListCached()
        Return the list of Node id's to Monitor as saved by the current instance.
        Returns:
        The list of nodes in the instance cache

        Parameters:
        NodeNo - The Node number
        Returns:

        public java.lang.String getNodeName(int NodeNo)
        Get the name of the Node. If the name has not been set, returns the ID of the Node.
        Parameters:
        NodeNo - the Node number
        Returns:
        the name or the ID of the Node

      • getNodeHostName

        public java.lang.String getNodeHostName(int NodeNo)
        Get the host name of the Node. If the host name has not been set, returns the IP of the Node.
        Parameters:
        NodeNo - the Node number
        Returns:
        the hostname or the IP of the Node

        Returns:
        The set of defined Node states.

        Map a Node state string to a state id.
        Parameters:
        Name - The name of the Node state
        Returns:
        The Node State

      • getNodeStateFromId

        Map a Node state id to a state string.
        Parameters:
        stateId - The id of the Node state
        Returns:
        The Node State

      • saveMonitorChanges

        public boolean saveMonitorChanges()
        Find if the list of monitors has changed since the last time it has been retrieved. If yes, the new list is saved in an appropriate instance.
        Returns:
        true if the list of monitors has changed, false otherwise

      • getMonitorIdList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getMonitorIdList()
        Return the list of all available Monitor Id's for the given system type. This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Returns:
        The list of monitorID's defined in the database
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • getMonitorSQL

        public java.lang.String getMonitorSQL(int monitor_id)
        Get the SQL command (or command string) associated with a particular Monitor. Although originally a simple SQL string for a Monitor to execute, other Monitor types have reused the string to contain Monitor specific data. This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Parameters:
        monitor_id - The Monitor ID to return the SQL data string for
        Returns:
        The "SQL" field of the Monitor
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • getMonitorClassInterval

        public int getMonitorClassInterval(java.lang.String monitorKey)
        Fetch the Monitor probe interval. This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Returns:
        The Monitor interval in seconds
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • getNamedMonitor

        public int getNamedMonitor(java.lang.String monitorKey)
        Fetch the id of a particular Monitor.
        Parameters:
        monitorKey - The Monitor name
        Returns:
        The monitor_id of the named Monitor or -1 if the Monitor was not found

      • getMonitorType

        public java.lang.String getMonitorType(int monitor_id)
        Return the type, and hence Monitor class, of a particular Monitor. This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Parameters:
        monitor_id - The Monitor ID
        Returns:
        The type field for the Monitor, e.g. SQL, CMD, CRM etc.
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • isMonitorSystemAverage

        public boolean isMonitorSystemAverage(int monitor_id)
        Is the system Monitor value cumulative or an average of all the nodes in the system? This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Parameters:
        monitor_id - The Monitor ID
        Returns:
        True if the system value of a Monitor is an average of all the nodes in the system
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • isMonitorDelta

        public java.lang.Boolean isMonitorDelta(int monitor_id)
        Is the monitored value a cumulative number or a snapshot value. This allows monitors to return values that are either the value in the database or the difference between the current value and the previous value. This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Parameters:
        monitor_id - The Monitor ID to check
        Returns:
        True of the Monitor is a delta of observed values
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • getMonitorKey

        public java.lang.String getMonitorKey(int monitor_id)
        Retrieve the (unique) Monitor key from the Monitor ID. This method does not call the API, but looks in the current cache.
        Parameters:
        monitor_id - the Monitor ID
        Returns:
        the Monitor key
        See Also:
        saveMonitorChanges to store the Monitor metadata in the local cache.

      • setSystemStatus

        public void setSystemStatus()
        Set the status of the system.

      • setSystemState

        public void setSystemState(java.lang.String state)
        Set the state of the system.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to which the system must be set

      • setNodeState

        public void setNodeState(int nodeid,
                int stateid)
        Set the state of a Node.
        Parameters:
        nodeid - The Node to set the state of
        stateid - The state to set for the Node

      • setNodeDatabaseProperties

        public void setNodeDatabaseProperties(int nodeid,
                             java.lang.String dbType,
                             java.lang.String dbVersion)
        Sets the database properties.
        Parameters:
        nodeid - The Node to set the state of
        dbType - The database type
        dbVersion - The database version

      • setNodePublicIP

        public boolean setNodePublicIP(int nodeID,
                      java.lang.String publicIP)
        Update the public IP address of a Node if it has changed.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The Node ID
        publicIP - The public IP address of the instance
        Returns:
        True if the IP address was updated

      • setNodePrivateIP

        public boolean setNodePrivateIP(int nodeID,
                       java.lang.String privateIP)
        setPrivateIP - Update the private IP of an instance. Only update the database if the new value differs from that already stored.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The Node ID as a string
        privateIP - The current private IP address
        Returns:
        boolean True if the IP address changed

      • mapCRMStatus

        public java.lang.String mapCRMStatus(java.lang.String state)
        Map a CRM state string to a valid Node state.
        Parameters:
        state - The CRM state
        Returns:
        The Node state

      • monitorData

        public boolean monitorData(int systemID,
                  int monitorID,
                  java.lang.String observation)
        Interface to record observed values for a system. This differs from the other entry points in that it passes the data onto the API.
        Parameters:
        systemID - The SystemID to update
        monitorID - The MonitorID the value is associated with
        observation - The observed value
        Returns:
        True if the Monitor observation was written

      • bulkMonitorData

        public boolean bulkMonitorData(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> monitorIDs,
                      java.lang.Integer systemID,
                      java.lang.Integer nodeID,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
        Batch request to the API. Adds the current timestamp to the data being sent, despite it is an optional parameter for the API. The API only accepts bulk data for one node, with an unlimited number of monitor data. However, the API ignores multiple values for the same Monitor.
        Parameters:
        monitorIDs - the ID's of the Monitor
        systemID - the ID of the monitored system
        nodeID - the ID of the monitored node
        values - the values to the passed to the API
        Returns:
        true if the update is performed, false otherwise

      • bulkMonitorData

        public boolean bulkMonitorData(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> monitorIDs,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> systemIDs,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodeIDs,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
        Batch request to the API. This method is not currently supported by the API.
        Parameters:
        monitorIDs - the ID's of the Monitor
        systemIDs - the ID of the monitored system
        nodeIDs - the ID of the monitored node
        values - the values to the passed to the API
        Returns:
        true if the update is performed, false otherwise
